intro: Leschenaultia baxteri, commonly known as the Baxter's leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, featuring small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Leschenaultia baxteri is often found in sandplain and gravelly habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
